summary: This is an email from July 29, 2020, regarding the case US v. Epstein. The sender provides an attached spreadsheet detailing the status of evidence from a hard drive, noting which data items were newly received versus previously provided as supplemental data.

events.title: Evidence Status Update Email
events.description: An email is sent with an attached spreadsheet ('evidenceStatus20200729.xlsx') detailing the status of evidence from a hard drive related to US v. Epstein, highlighting data that was newly received versus previously provided.

keyFacts: The document is an email dated July 29, 2020, concerning the case US v. Epstein.
An attached spreadsheet catalogs evidence from a hard drive, with items highlighted to indicate they were newly received.
Several evidence items (NYCO24328, NYCO24366, NYCO24392) are noted as having been provided again but were on the first set of data.
Supplemental data was provided for several other evidence items (NYCO24363, NYCO24365, NYCO24371, NYCO24383).
The communication appears to be between law enforcement or legal personnel coordinating evidence review, though specific individuals are not named.
